post.summary: Sends a cancel command from the POS software to terminate any in-flight operations.
post.description: sends a cancel command from the POS software to terminate any in-flight operations.

200.description: Cancel received.  This does not indicate that the cancel was processed correctly, only that it was received.

post.summary: Display a message on a device
post.description: A call to the display endpoint sends a text string, which is displayed on the idle terminal.

post.summary: Retrieves a list of printers from the device.
post.description: Retrieves a list of printers from the device.

200.description: A response from the device containing a list of printers.

post.summary: Sends an image print job to the device.
post.description: Sends an image print job to the device.

post.summary: Sends a text print job to the device.
post.description: Sends a text print job to the device.

post.summary: Retrieves a confirmation response (either true or false) from the specified device.
post.description: Retrieves a confirmation response (either true or false) from the specified terminal.  This is used to obtain a response from a customer (typically).

200.description: Returns a true or false response, based on input to the terminal.

post.summary: Retrieves a text response from the specified device.
post.description: Displays a request for information, and returns the data. Allows the calling system to specify a pre-defined format.

200.description: Returns a test string response, based on input to the terminal.

post.summary: Retrieves a signature from the specified device.
post.description: Retrieves a signature from the specified terminal.

200.description: Returns a test string response, based on input to the terminal.

post.summary: Display a message on a device requesting entry of a tip amount.
post.description: Display a message on a device requesting entry of a tip amount.

post.summary: Display a thank you screen on a device
post.description: Displays the thank you screen on the idle terminal.

post.summary: Display the welcome screen on a device
post.description: Displays the welcome screen on the idle terminal.

post.summary: Creates a token that may be used with subsequent transactions
post.description: A call to the token endpoint is used to create either a single use or multi-pay token that can be used in subsequent transactions.

post.summary: Reads the track data off the provided card
post.description: A call to the read card endpoint initiates a read card operation on the device and returns the card track data.  The data will be encrypted unless the card read is NOT a financial card or if the BIN has been white listed.
Charges a credit card or other payment source using the data in the provided `charge` object

requestBody.description: An object describing a charge to be applied to the specified source

capture.description: Specifies if the charge is to be captured immediately. The default value is `true`. If the value is set to `false`, the charge transaction type is AUTH (or PRE-AUTH), and the charge can be captured at a later point using the `/v1/charges/{id}/capture` endpoint.

receipt_email.description: Email address which receives the charge receipt

get.description: Returns the details of an existing charge. This data is also returned when a charge is first created or if it is refunded.

post.description: A new refund must be associated with an existing charge. Refunds are applied to the `source` used for the original payment. Partial refunds can be performed up to the original charge amount.

requestBody.description: An object describing a refund to be applied

charge.description: Unique ID of the charge to refund

amount.description: Refund amount in cents. You can only refund the remaining, unrefunded amount of the charge.

get.description: Returns details of a specific refund

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: UUID of the refund to retrieve

post.description: As step two of the two-part payment flow, captures the payment of an existing but uncaptured charge. An uncaptured charge is first created by setting the `capture` value to `false`.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: UUID of the charge to be captured

requestBody.description: Used to capture the full or partial amount of the specified charge

amount.description: Charge amount in the smallest monetary unit of the merchant's currency. If you do not specify an amount, the total of the original charge is captured.

receipt_email.description: Email address which receives the charge receipt. This value overrides any previously-specified email address for the charge. Receipts are not sent in sandbox.

200.description: Returns the charge object with the captured value set to true. This method returns an error if the charge is already set to `refunded`, `expired`, or `captured`, or if an invalid capture amount is specified.

DeviceId.name: X-Clover-Device-Id
DeviceId.description: The device to route the request to.

PosId.name: X-POS-Id
PosId.description: An identifier for the POS making the request.

IdempotencyKey.name: Idempotency-Key
IdempotencyKey.description: The idempotency key transmitted during the request, if any.

400.description: The request is invalid, and subsequent calls will continue to fail; do not repeat the call.

401.description: An invalid bearer token has been provided.  The call may be repeated if the provided bearer token is updated.

415.description: The request is invalid, and contains request data in an unsupported format.  This call may be repeated if the content is changed to a supported format.

500.description: The request processing failed with an unknown error, and the processing state of the operation is indeterminate.  Do not repeat the call without additional analysis.

501.description: Device is not available for this call.  This means that the device does not have the ability to respond to this; do not repeat the call.

503.description: Device is not available for this call.  This means that the device is currently occupied servicing another call.  This can be repeated at a later time, or cancel may be called to cancel any in-flight operations and reset the device.

504.description: Device did not respond in a timely manner.  This can be repeated at a later time.

CancelRequest.title: CancelRequest
CancelRequest.description: A cancel request.  Cancels operation(s) or 'resets' the device.

ConfirmationRequest.title: ConfirmationRequest

beep.description: A true/false flag that indicates if a beep should be played when the screen is initially displayed.

acceptText.description: Label text displayed on the button for positive confirmation

rejectText.description: Label text displayed on the button for negative confirmation

ConfirmationRequest.description: Used when calling a device endpoint that needs to solicit confirmation from the user.

DisplayRequest.title: DisplayRequest

beep.description: A true/false flag that indicates if a beep should be played when the text is initially displayed.

DisplayRequest.description: Used when calling a device endpoint that needs a display message.

example.text: Message to display to a customer

FormatDisplayRequest.title: FormatDisplayRequest

beep.description: A true/false flag that indicates if a beep should be played when the screen is initially displayed.

format.description:
The format that is to be used for the prompt.
Values used by BOLT: "PHONE", "AMOUNT", "MMYY", "Nx[,y]", "ANx[,y]".  A more general format could be used to allow for these and other formats, we could have explicit support for these, or we could define a structure that allows for more complex format specification.  In the interest of simplicity, we should exclude the "Nx[,y]", "ANx[,y]", and use the other BOLT formats, and support a simple TEXT type to ensure we can handle anything.

FormatDisplayRequest.description: Message used to call to the display endpoint sends a text string.

IntegerResponse.title: IntegerResponse
IntegerResponse.description: This is an integer with 2 decimal points implied, for example 100 = 1.00

PingRequest.title: PingRequest
PingRequest.description: Used when calling a device endpoint to ping the device for proof of life.

PingResponse.title: PingResponse
PingResponse.description: The result of a ping request

printDeviceId.description: An id obtained from the list of ids in the retrieve printers call, or null for default.

printJobId.description: A unique id for the request

printDeviceId.description: An id obtained from the list of ids in the retrieve printers call, or null for default.

printJobId.description: A unique id for the request

gzip.description: A flag that indicates true if the data was gzipped before performing the base64 encoding

SignatureRequest.title: SignatureRequest

gzip.description: A flag that indicates true if the data should be gzipped before performing the base64 encoding

SignatureRequest.description: Message used to call to the display endpoint sends a text string.

SignatureResponse.title: SignatureResponse
SignatureResponse.description: The response to a request for a signature

ThankYouRequest.title: ThankYouRequest
ThankYouRequest.description: Used when calling a device endpoint to display the thank you screen.

TipDisplayRequest.title: TipDisplayRequest

tipSuggestions.description: A set of tip configurations to use when displaying the tip screen.  If omitted defaults will be used. The options 'custom tip' and 'no tip' are always offered.

baseAmount.description: For percentage tip suggestions, this is the amount the calculated tips will be based upon.  This is an integer with 2 decimal points implied, for example 100 = 1.00

TipDisplayRequest.description: A request to display the tip screen with optional message, base amount and tip configurations.

name.description: A string to display on the suggestion.  If omitted, either the amount of the tip, or the percentage will be displayed.

percentage.description: A percentage to use when calculating the suggestion.  The amount may be overridden if the calculation results in an amount less then the 'minimumsuggestion' on the TipDisplayRequest.

amount.description: An absolute amount to use for the suggestion.

WelcomeRequest.title: WelcomeRequest
WelcomeRequest.description: Used when calling a device endpoint to display the welcome screen.

CardEntryMethod.title: CardEntryMethod
CardEntryMethod.description: Enumeration which defines the different card entry methods.

TokenRequest.title: TokenRequest

cardEntryMethods.description: A collection of supported card entry methods for the operation.

tokenType.description: The type of token requested.  If not specified, a Clover legacy token will be returned. Supported values: ECOMM_COMPAT

TokenRequest.description: A request to generate a token for use in subsequent transactions.

ReadCardRequest.title: ReadCardRequest

cardEntryMethods.description: A collection of supported card entry methods for the operation.

ReadCardRequest.description: Used to retrieve the track data from a card

TokenResponse.title: TokenResponse
TokenResponse.description: The information about the created token

ReadCardResponse.title: ReadCardResponse
ReadCardResponse.description: The track data read from the card

charge.description: Returned when a card-related error occurs. Unique ID of the failed charge.

code.description: Additional information about the error that you can use to provide user-friendly handling of the issue

decline_code.description: Returned when a card issuer declines the transaction. This includes the reason for the decline if specified by the card issuer.

doc_url.description: URL for more information about the reported error code

message.description: Detailed information about the error code. For card-related errors, this information can be used to better inform users.

param.description: If the error is related to a specific parameter, this value lists the parameter so you can inform users entering card information of a particular problem with their entry

amount.description: Total charge amount in the smallest monetary unit of the merchant's currency

amount_refunded.description: Amount refunded in cents. This value can be less than the amount property on the charge if a partial refund is issued.

captured.description: For charges not captured when the charge was created, this value will be `false` if the charge remains uncaptured or `true` if it has been captured

customer.description: Unique ID of the customer associated with the charge

description.description: Container for user-facing information about the object

failure_code.description: If available, the error code explaining the reason for the charge failure

failure_message.description: If available, detailed information about the reason for the charge failure

livemode.description: Set to `true` if the object is in production. `Set` to false if the object is in sandbox.

metadata.description: Set of key-value pairs used for storing additional information about the object in a structured format.

object.description: Object type. Objects with the same type have the same value.

order.description: Unique ID of the order associated with the charge

paid.description: Set to `true` if the charge is successful or authorized for capture at a later point

payment_method.description: Unique ID of the payment method used for the charge

receipt_email.description: Email address which receives the charge receipt

refunded.description: Set to `true` if the charge is fully refunded or `false` if only partially refunded

refunds.description: List of refunds applied to the charge

has_more.description: Set to `true` if there is another page of list items after the current page

object.description: Object type. Objects with the same type have the same value.

url.description: URL of the list of refunds

refunds.title: RefundList

source.description: Charge source (typically a credit or debit card)

network_status.description: The status of the transaction with respect to the card network associated with the card.

reason.description: A more detailed explanation of the outcome

risk_level.description: Clover’s payment risk evaluation. Evaluated payments will have one of three risk values: `normal`, `elevated`, or `highest`. The risk is `not_assessed` for cash or other non-card payments, as well as card payments without an assigned level of risk. If the value is `unknown`, the risk evaluation failed due to an error.

risk_score.description: Clover’s payment risk evaluation. Evaluated payments are scored between 0 and 100. This field is not present for non-card payments or when the evaluation failed due to an error.

rule.description: Unique ID of the matching rule used to evaluate the payment

seller_message.description: A detailed description of the outcome type and reason (intended for the merchant, not the customer).

type.description: Basic explanation of the charge's outcome.

amount.description: Total amount of the refund in the smallest monetary unit of the merchant's currency

charge.description: UUID of the charge that was refunded

description.description: (Only for non-card refunds) Container for user-facing information about the object

failure_reason.description: Explanation of why the refund cannot be performed

metadata.description: Set of key-value pairs used for storing additional information about the object in a structured format.

object.description: Object type. Objects with the same type have the same value.

receipt_number.description: Transaction number that appears on the receipt emailed for this charge

status.description: Refund status (for credit card refunds, `succeeded` or `failed`; for other refund types, `pending`, `succeeded`, `failed`, or `canceled`)
